name: Hotel-Pension Bregenz

reviews.title: Great place
reviews.text: We stayed in Hotel-Pension Bregenz for 5 nights in mid March 2013 and it was splendid. Christian and his wife were very friendly, helpful, and full of information. The room was clean and bright. The street is quiet and just 7 min walk to the bus or U ban station. Nice breakfast, more than we hoped for. We highly recommend the place and definitely will stay there again.

reviews.title: excellent family run, friendly, clean hotel
reviews.text: Idit&Eyal

reviews.title: lovely stay - highly recommended
reviews.text: We stayed in hotel-pension bregenz for a week in August/September 2012 - our 9 month old son, my husband and I in a family and my father in a single room.

reviews.title: Great value
reviews.text: We found it to be a very lovely hotel. Well located - easy to use the public transport. Our family room was very generous in size, clean and the bathroom was also very nice. We enjoyed a lovely view out over the quiet, tree lined street. My Dad's single room was also quite large for a single room and also very clean and well furnished.

reviews.title: Worth it.
reviews.text: Breakfast was good. Overall this is a very good value, very friendly and welcoming hotel and if we visit Berlin again we will certainly stay at Pension Bregenz.
Having read the previous reviews here, me and my wife decided to embark on a long weekend at the Bregenz in May 2005.
reviews.title: Nothing To Complain About
A wonderful place to stay!
reviews.text: We were installed in the only room that hadn't been refurbished due to our late booking, but never fear it was perfectly good and even had a balcony!

We found Christian (the proprieter) to be a very good natured guy. He did all he could to make our stay comfortable, dispensing annotated maps and giving good advice from his vast store of knowledge, all at the drop of a hat. Never once was he too busy to give us some of his time- very important as we had to 'hit the ground running' to get the most out of our short break.
reviews.title: Wonderful and cheerily run family hotel

reviews.text: Bedrooms are very comfortable, with mini-bar (the first one I've ever encountered with reasonable prices!), cable tv, room safe (does it work?), wardrobe, clock and nice bathroom. Breakfast (buffet style) was particularly enjoyable, comprising of various breads, cake, eggs, tomatoes, cucumber, cheeses, cooked meats and salamis, yoghourt, preserves, teas, coffee, juice, milk. There were more items but I can't remember all! And nicely presented - hygienically kept under cling film.
reviews.title: Very Friendly Place

reviews.text: The area, just off 'Ku Damm' was very quiet, yet handy for restaurants and shops, buses, underground etc.- by the way, be warned not many places take credit cards (the hotel does) especially restaurants! But there's a cash machine close at hand.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Berlin

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in July 2006. We had a truly great experience. This is a cozy family run place. The owners Christian and Tanja are very helpful and went out of their way to make us feel at home. They gave us advice on where to buy affordable baby supplies for our 10 month old son and provided us with a cot for him. The room was clean and had a wonderful balcony. It was very in Berlin during our stay but we were provided with a fan which was enough for us. We could also leave the balcony windows open and there was no noise issue. The hotel is located in a residential area but close to the u-bahn and bus stops. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. Christian even told us where to find a laundromat nearby. Any question you have or advice you need Christian will lend a hand with. Will definetly stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.text: I agree completely with the positive comments already made. This was our first stop in Europe and we could not have felt more welcome. Christian went out of his way to offer his help and make sure we felt comfortable getting around the city. It doesn't come across in the picture but our room was bright, clean and a good size. Our balcony overlooked a very pretty, quiet street. We were able to sleep with the windows open with no noise problems. I can see how some would think the breakfast was not very exciting by American standards, but we still found plenty to fill us up (cereal, yogurt, coffee, etc).
reviews.title: Wonderful stay! Absolutely no complaints!
Really nice family-owned hotel
reviews.text: It's in a great location with a very easy walk to the Kurfurstendamm and lots of nice restaurants close by. We especially liked the Greek restaurant and found the staff to be very friendly. If we ever make it back to Berlin we will definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Everything we expected
reviews.text: Had a lovely time staying for a couple of days here, they were very helpful and friendly, upgraded our room without being asked when someone else cancelled, spent along while talking us through the best places to go and how to get to those places (in almost perfect English) and had a great breakfast every morn with lots to choose from and plenty of everything.

Many thanks to those before me who have recommended this wonderful little hotel. It was spotless and the neighborhood was very pretty. As mentioned many times, the owners go out of their way to be of help. As mom traveling alone with my two teenage children I felt quite safe in this location. Breakfast was a tad skimpy for a teenage boy, but my daughter and I felt it was plenty. Our bathroom was a little on the small side but the room was large, bright and immaculate. We were able to walk most places or hop on the nearby metro so it was very convenient.
reviews.title: Thanks for the TripAdvisor recommendation!
Nice place
reviews.text: A quiet, clean and ok located place to stay (15 min walk from the Zoo station). Price is good and the people who work there are very helpfull. The room and bathroom are new, but the shower is a bit complicated, as for to find the right temperature. Breakfast is good too. I can recommend.

reviews.title: One week in Heaven.
reviews.text: Found this wonderful non-smoking hotel on TripAdvisor. Quiet, clean well appointed room with modern WC. Located on a nice quiet side street but near everything you could want. Very friendly owner helped us plan each day (in English). Good breakfast with nice atmosphere. Loads of great sidewalk cafes very close by for dinner. They have the maps, brochures and transportation passes. Busses to everywhere just one block away. Hated to go home.

I agree with other posters: the hotel is in a pretty, quiet, residential block 1-1/2 blocks to the Ku'damm (the main shopping street in West Berlin). The #109 bus stops at the Ku'damm's corner -- just a few minutes from the bus's launching from the "Zoo" rail station. Christian is a true host, ever helpful in providing maps and suggestions.
reviews.title: Hotel quality in a Pension style

reviews.text: We stayed three nights at the Hotel Bregenz in late July. The hotel is excellently located though we did have to use public transportation to get around--Berlin is a big city. The proprietor was friendly and knowledgeable; the breakfast quite nice. The room itself was fine, though unremarkable. Only one complaint: the sun streams in the bedroom windows early in the morning. Don't plan on sleeping in.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose the Hotel-Pension Bregenz based on comments of other Trip Advisor reviews, and found the positives all justified by our experience. Location is quiet yet close to everything (once you get used to the public transport system). Cleanliness of facilities excellent, breakfast fresh and healthy, Christian and his charming wife always ready with a smile. Instead of the impersonal scripts of the major chains you meet a real Berliner (I'm not talking sugar-topped doughnuts here); whatever your interests, suggestions are lightly made as to things you might enjoy doing. For instance, Christian suggested we could easily travel as far as Potsdam to see Frederick the Great's palaces, and to the beautiful Peacock Island near Wannsee; these turned out to be some our most enjoyable excursions. There is only so much history one can take when travelling (no matter how many museums one planned to visit). With the guidance of a relaxed and friendly host, there are many low -cost yet intriguing and pleasant options you would not know about even from the top 'official' guidebooks. The plumbing may be a little eccentric - well, a few odd noises and poor drainage in a shower - but perfectly OK. Wi-fi good to keep in touch with home. Only lack - a kettle in the room to make a cup of tea at night. I would stay here again if I get the chance. Get the 109 bus from the airport, get off at Adenauerplatz and you are three minutes walk away from arriving to a place you can unwind and prepare to explore the rich and tragic story of Berlin.
reviews.title: Low stress holiday base in Berlin

reviews.text: We recently stayed in this lovely pension and they really make us feel so welcome . The location is amazing if wanting to go to museums and all the attractions in Berlin. The service is so friendly and helpful, that you do not need to go to any tourist office to plan your day. We stay the first time in a triple room, really nice, and later in a double. We were lucky to find this excellent hotel. The staff, service and location of the hotel makes it a must for us to return. The room and the bathroom were very clean. Another important thing is that you can find several good restaurants very near, even in the same block. The breakfast was included in our rate and It was very nice and with a lot of options.
reviews.title: Great Pension in Berlin!

reviews.text: I spent three nights at Bregenz and really enjoyed its quiet distance yet close proximity to so much (not far from Savigny Platz, KuDamm, etc.) and the conversation/hosting of Christian. Such a nice guy, full of good information/ideas, including the more off-beat type that I go for (jazz, riding a bicycle on the old runways at Tempelhof, etc.) Be sure to speak with him during your visit. And yes, he speaks perfect English.
reviews.title: Simple, Classic and Very Helpful
A Lovely B & B in Berlin
reviews.text: The room was simple, but with a very good shower/bathroom. It's not a four-star hotel, but you're also paying less than a two-star price. For the value and location, I agree that Bregenz is hard to beat and would definitely stay there again. By the way, the variety of restaurant ethnicities in the surrounding three blocks is superb (Indian, Lebanese, American Diner, Italian, Vietnamese). You're also not far from a slew of Asian places.

There isn't much we ca add to the positive reviews others have offered, but I wanted to join in their recommendations of this great little hotel in Berlin. Christian is extremely helpful, as others have noted.
reviews.title: Great Cozy Budget Hotel in Convenient Berlin Location

reviews.text: Our room was attractive, clean, and comfortable, and the hotel's convenient location, in a quiet neighborhood is a definite plus.
reviews.title: What a great family-friendly place to stay in Berlin!

reviews.text: This place is quite a hidden gem for those wishing to stay in a very family-friendly establishment. Rooms range in size, with up to quadruple occupancy rooms available. The place is spotless and the rooms are comfortable, even for families. This establishment is run by a young couple, who took over managing the hotel from the husband's mother when she retired last year. For a small 14-room pension-style hotel, this place really does very well and reservations are almost always needed. The hotel is within a 3 minute walk to a main bus stop on the Kuddamm and is located in a quite residential part of Berlin. Several small neighborhood restaurants and a great fruit/vegetable shop are so close. VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED HOTEL FOR FAMILIES!
reviews.title: Recommended
Wonderful value
reviews.text: I can only agree with all the other positive things written about this hotel - my wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and found it very good value, comfortable, clean, quiet with a very friendly and helpful owner and an excellent breakfast. The profusion of plastic plants may seem a little quirky but so what?

reviews.title: A Gem in Berlin
reviews.text: I can't say enough positive things about the hotel. The location is great - in Wilmersdorff, not far from the Ku'damm, well within walking distance of two U-bahn stops, an S-bahn stop, as well as the bus. The place is kept spotlessly clean. Breakfast is plentiful and delicious. The room rate is very reasonable. Christian, the owner has an engaging personality and is fun to chat with. I just finished my second stay in three years, and look forward to a third.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: My husband & two adult children had 2 rooms for our 2 night stay in Berlin. The hotel was in a great location. Christian had provided excellent directions to the hotel using public transport & there was just a short walk from the bus stop to the hotel. The hotel is about 10 minutes by bus from the centre of Berlin. The hotel is on the 3rd floor & there is a lift. The rooms are basic, but very clean & comfortable. Breakfast was very good & Christian is extremely helpful, providing maps & sightseeing tips & even has bus passes & works out which one is the best value. Rooms are very quiet, as well. I would recommend to anyone wanting good value accommodation close to transport

reviews.title: Wonderful stay, great location, great accomodations
reviews.text: Christian and his family have created a wonderful hotel experience right off Ku'dam in Berlin. From the outset, Christian is very welcoming and helpful. He has maps and transit passes for purchase right there, which is a great help. Check in was fast and easy and he continued to be helpful during my 5 night stay.

reviews.title: Tips from Host are Gems
reviews.text: All rooms are on one floor of the building. There is a small elevator that brings you from street level right to the floor of the pension. My room was right off the elevator and reception area, but I never heard any noise from either within my room. There is a good internal door system so things stay fairly quiet. The only noise I heard was from neighbors using the inner courtyard, but they quieted down as the night wore on. The room was comfortable, clean and good-sized, as was the bathroom. I felt completely at home and was comfortable spending time in the room at night.

reviews.title: Home Atmosphere
reviews.text: Breakfast is wonderful and has many offerings. I never had trouble getting a spot for breakfast and found the other guests friendly.

I’ve stayed here twice & enjoyed both visits. It’s convenient to about anything you need. The bus stop, grocery, restaurants, & Starbucks are less than a three or four minute walk. Included in the price of the room are excellent wi-fi and a good breakfast.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: The last time I was in Berlin, I found a bargain price on a five-star business hotel via Hotwire. It was a nice hotel, but I like Bregenz much better. The better rooms at the Bregenz are larger than the 5-star hotel. Wi-fi and breakfast aren’t expensive add-ons. The neighborhood is more interesting, active, yet safe and quiet. With the big chain hotels you don’t get a lot of local flavor, unlike a small locally owned hotel.
reviews.title: Repeat stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have mentioned, the owner is very helpful in providing advice and assistance.
reviews.title: BOOK HERE!

reviews.text: I enjoyed walking around the neighborhood. It is a safe area with pleasant and interesting streets.
reviews.title: Just Wonderful

reviews.text: The hotel is on one floor of a 5 or 6 story apartment building. I think there are only about 15 to 20 rooms. So it is more of a guest house than a hotel. Usually the only time you will see anyone there is during breakfast.
reviews.title: Very good
Hotel Bregenz is top for warmth, hospitality and location!
reviews.text: Had an excellent stay here! We came for business and had a headache trying to coordinate packages to arrive, but the family that runs the hotel was unbelievably accomodating and helpful--couldn't have done it without them! Hotel Bregenz is very warm and friendly--every morning there is a great breakfast spread enhanced only by the nice conversation of the staff. The rooms on the right wing are being completely refurbished, so I very much look forward to my next stay in Berlin here. It is great value for money, and really adds a personal touch to your holiday. The location also can't be beat. Tons of amazing restaurants surround the area. We enjoyed dinner at a great sushi restaurant right around the corner (where the sushi is creatively presented in tiny wooden boats), also had an unbelievable meal at a top Austrian restaurant--all within a 5 minute walk.

reviews.title: Sorry to rain on everyone's parade
reviews.text: I have just returned from a five-day stay at the Pension Bregenz, which I chose because of the high reviews it received here. I wish that I could be as enthusiastic as the rest of the reviewers, but this is definitely not a hotel for everybody.

description: Our Berlin hotel-guest house provides a personal service to you and your family.Our family-run city hotel with personal charm an ambience is to be found just a short walk from the famous "Kurfürstendamm" (Ku´Damm). We gladly offer our help and assistance with regard to visiting theatres, concerts or opera.We also take care of reservations for restaurants,sightseeing tours etc... Tickets for public transport are available from the reception of the hotel.A friendly house at friendly prices.
